intro: Cyclamen punicum, commonly known as the Persian cyclamen, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Middle East and parts of Turkey. It is characterized by its distinctive heart-shaped leaves and vibrant, showy flowers that come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters and prefers cool, moist environments. Cyclamen punicum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and ability to thrive in indoor conditions. Its blooming period usually occurs in late winter to early spring, making it a popular choice for seasonal decoration.
